description.narrative:
The Clarisse Machanguana Foundation is an Organization based in Maputo, created in 2015 that acts at the national level in the following thematic areas: Gender, Health, Sexual Rights and Reproductive Health, access to information and citizens engagement.
ThroughAGIR funding, this organization intends to carry out the initiative "Mothers and Daughters" with the aim of improving access to information on the importance of knowing the HIV status of HIV testing and supporting positive women and young people to start and remain on antiretroviral treatment. This will be achieved through the creation and training of different groups of women (mothers and daughters) working in the sensitization for behavior change, testing, adherence and retention in the ART; Creation of different groups(students, daughters and mothers) to address issues such as HIV / AIDS, treatment and other related issues; Use of social influencers to disseminate messages (testing, adherence to treatment and maintenance in treatment among others) through the media and social networks; Increased participation of mothers and guardians in school activities.
With the creation and training of these women's groups (Mothers and Daughters), the foundation hopes to empower women, their families and communities to address taboo topics. It alsohopes to raise the awareness of these mothers to spread to their families and communities the need to know their HIV status and theimportance of following antiretroviral treatment.

participating-org.narrative:
The Clarisse Machanguana Foundation is a Mozambican nonprofit organization based in Maputo. The FCM was officially constituted under the Mozambican legislation on 16 December 2014, although its history goes much further. The FCM was born of the dream of its founder, Clarisse Machanguana, to bring opportunities for the youngsters of their native Mozambique.
FCM's vision is to empower young people to realize their roles as positive contributors in the society in which they live, connecting them with their potentials and talents, empowering and giving them a voice, fortifying their self-esteem and improving their health through Sport and education. Its mission is to help young people see opportunities in every challenge, and to motivate and inspire change through sustainable programs involving youth. The Foundation is guided by the values of transparency, responsibility, innovation and inspiration. The objectives of the FCM are summarized as follows: # To be a leading Organization in defense of Sport for Youth, Health and Education affectingpolicies and attitude change for the benefit of young people; # Leverage FCM's founder's popularity to mobilize opinion leaders, community leaders, and sponsors in support of youth development. # Leverage funds and support for the implementation of programs focused on sports, education and health. # Inspire young people throughout Mozambique, and other places, involving them in positive change for themselves and their communities, enabling them to realize their potential. # Operate as an effective organization, providing a model of good governance and transparency.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
